metadata.title: CVE-2019-9824 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
tcp_emu in slirp/tcp_subr.c (aka slirp/src/tcp_subr.c) in QEMU 3.0.0 usesuninitialized data in an snprintf call, leading to Information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.38').
